content.description: A continuously sustained route with a double pinch / vise grip in the center of the route. Start at the face just left of the large right facing crack. Step up onto the face and climb over the small one foot wide arrête straddling it. Gain two pinch holds at the small roof and continue up the upper small arrête.  When waist high with the big roof on the left, traverse left with feet under the roof until you're under the vertical crack line.  Step over the roof and up the flakes to the top.
content.location: Just left of the right facing flake/crack and Left of the 4th arrête.

content.description: Climb the corner and step left to stem over the first roof.  At the second roof reach out right over the roof for a jug.  Pull up on thin sharp edges and climb the grove to the top.
content.location: Inside corner to the right of Arete 3, with a roof quarter the way up.  Same start as "Stem It"

content.description: Start by the crack and below the small roof a few feet left of the inside corner. Climb up and thru the shallow roof. Finish climbing in and through the offwidth / chimney crack.
content.location: The Purple route on the beta photo.

content.description: Start on the left wall at the inside corner between Arete #1 and #2. Use both cracks and hand/fist/arm jam your way up until the cracks meet.  Follow the inside corner on the right to the top. Makes for a nice lead.
content.protection: Top system from trees. Trad: gear to 3"...hexes work too!
content.location: The Green route on the beta photo for the 1st Arete.

content.description: Start below the obvious gaping wide crack on the 4th Arete. To avoid overloading the wall with too many climbs I'll just say that there are 3 variations, climb the wall left of the crack, climb the crack, climb the wall to the right of the crack.
content.location: This is the Red route on the 4th Arete beta photo.

content.description: On the 4th Arete and a few feet right of Turkey Trot is a right ascending series of shallow inside corners. Follow the diagonal line to the top.  Variations are to ascend thru the bulges or to start further right.
content.location: The Orange route on the 4th Arete beta photo.

content.description: Start at the inside corner. Follow the corner moving left around the overhang, stem when necessary.
content.location: The Yellow route on the 3rd Arete beta photo.

content.description: Start at the inside corner between the seconds and third Arete. Climb the right facing wall until blocked by a small bulge.  Step left and continue up the face.
content.location: The Purple route on the 2nd Arete beta photo.

content.description: Start on a small inside corner near the nose of the 1st arete. Climb past 2 small bulges to the top.
content.location: On the 1st arete to the left. Red route on beta photo.

content.description: Start on the wall to the right of The Road Less Traveled. Climb up to the small roof/bulge and work left until it’s possible to go up the remainder of the wall. (Orange route)
content.location: The Orange route on the beta photo of the 1st Arete.

content.description: Start on the right wall of the third Arete.  Difficult moves off the ground. Once off the ground move up and left to the top.
content.location: The Green route on the 3rd Arete beta photo.

content.description: Start at the nose of the arête. Climb straight to the top. Variations are making use of the wall immediately left or right of the nose.
content.location: The Yellow route on the 4th Arete beta photo.

content.description: Start a few feet right of “A Wrinkle”.  As with all of the other routes here, head up following a variety of potential sequences.
content.location: This is the Blue route on the 4th Arete beta photos.

content.description:
Start in the middle of the right hand side of the arête. Climb several variations.               

4th Arete Right: Yellow - Flying Blue, Green - A Wrinkle In Time, Blue - Broken Hand and Foot Hold
content.location: The Green route in the 4th Arete beta photos.

content.description:
This area has lots moderate problems on complex faces. Left to right, Arete 1 to Arete 4. All routes can be set with rope top systems to trees. Like all walls here there is a nice sunny exposure. It kind of feels like being in a climbing gym the way the wall zig and zags with some overhanging sides.When we setup and climbed the 4th Arete we climbed 10 distinct lines using 3 top system placements. All of the climbs are in the 5.6 to 5.7 range. As most of the routes reach the top they ease up to about 5.5. We decided to define 5 lines as representative zones.               

Four Aretes Area Overview
